ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend it to a student if they are willing to put in a lot of work and learn independently. Most learning is done on your own, class very lightly reinforces what you prepared.
The best way to improve your Greek writing and reading skill, as well as your understanding of Greek language.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This was a required course for graduate students. It helped me pay attention to smaller details in text (conjunctions, tenses, etc).
Helps a lot with knowing vocab wnd syntax
The course is invaluable for my dissertation which will be on the Plato's stylistics.

Obviously the concepts learned this semester will play a tremendous role as I prepare for the Greek translation exams, and my readings of Greek for my dissertation and future research will benefit immensely. Would that I had learned a fraction of what I gained from this course in my survey class this semester!
